title: WHO says soda sweetener aspartame may cause cancer, but it's safe within limits
description: The International Agency for Research on Cancer identified a possible link between aspartame and a type of liver cancer called hepatocellular carcinoma.

title: WHO decision on aspartame could hurt diet soda sales or lead to new drink formulas
description: Coca-Cola, PepsiCo and Keurig Dr Pepper may decide to change their formulas and swap out aspartame for another sweetener.

title: Meta Threads engagement has dropped off since red-hot debut, tracking firms say
description: Facebook's Twitter-killer, Threads, has seen drops in daily active users and time spent on app, according to SensorTower and SimilarWeb.

title: XRP coin surges after judge delivers a huge win to Ripple in its case against the SEC
description: Ripple's XRP token surged on Thursday after a judge in the Southern District of New York ruled that it's "not necessarily a security on its face."

title: Elon Musk's SpaceX nears $150 billion valuation after secondary share sale
description: The valuation of Elon Musk's SpaceX hit near $150 billion following a share sale by existing investors announced this week, CNBC has learned.

title: Canadian West Coast ports strike is over, but it will take weeks for supply chain to recover
description: The West Coast port strike is over, with ILWU Canada and port owners reaching a deal brokered by Canada's government, but supply chain delays will last weeks.

title: Record heat meets record wildfires in Canada, and scientists say this is the new reality
description: Record high temperatures add fuel to the record wildfire season in Canada, with more heat and wildfires yet to come this year.

title: St. Louis Fed President Bullard says he's stepping down in August
description: The St. Louis Federal Reserve announced Thursday that Jim Bullard will step down from his post as president, effective Aug. 14.

title: Former Celsius CEO arrested, company agrees to pay $4.7 billion settlement
description: Ex-Celsius CEO Alex Mashinsky was arrested on federal securities fraud charges as the FTC announced a $4.7 billion settlement with the bankrupt crypto exchange.

title: 'I am not Amazon' and 'people want to see gratitude': UK minister's comments on Ukraine cause a stir
description: Ben Wallace's remarks were made on the side lines of a NATO summit in Lithuania.

title: Disney could soon sell its TV assets as Iger says business 'may not be core' to the company
description: Disney CEO Bob Iger appeared for an interview with CNBC's David Faber the morning after announcing a contract extension through 2026.

title: Disney pulling back on making Marvel, Star Wars content, Iger says
description: Disney CEO Bob Iger said Thursday on CNBC that the company will cut back on its content creation for major franchises Marvel and Star Wars.

title: Europe sizzles as a heatwave sweeps the continent, pushing temperatures close to record levels
description: Climate scientists are deeply concerned about a recent spate of global heat records.

title: Disney is open to finding a new strategic partner for ESPN, Iger says
description: Disney is open to selling a stake in ESPN and is looking for a strategic partner as it prepares its transition to streaming, CEO Bob Iger said in an interview.

title: Strategist David Roche says we'll avoid a global recession, central banks will 'change the goalposts'
description: Central banks will "change the goalposts without really saying so," on monetary policy, according to veteran strategist David Roche.

title: IEA trims oil demand forecast for the first time this year on 'persistent' economic headwinds
description: The IEA on Thursday cut its global oil demand growth forecast for the first time this year, primarily citing a worsening economic outlook.

title: Will Smith-backed U.S. broker Public launches in the UK in first foray overseas
description: The move will see Public compete with a flurry of well-established digital brokerage platforms, as well as upstarts like Revolut and Freetrade.

title: China finalizes first-of-its-kind rules governing generative A.I. services like ChatGPT
description: Chinese regulators on Thursday said it finalized first-of-its-kind rules governing generative artificial intelligence which will come into effect on Aug. 15.

title: Google says Bard can now use images and give audio responses
description: The improvements come as Google tries to stay ahead of rapidly improving competition from Microsoft-backed OpenAI, Anthropic, and others

title: Philippines allows 'Barbie' movie to be screened, calls China map 'cartoonish'
description: Unexpected controversy over China's "nine-dash line" shows that life in plastic may not always be quite as fantastic.

title: Inflation is 'history' for the U.S, says veteran economist Steve Hanke
description: Veteran economist Steve Hanke's believes the U.S. no longer an inflation problem.

title: China's June trade data badly misses expectations
description: China's exports contracted more than expected in June, hit by shrinking global demand and adding to concerns about the world's second-largest economy.

title: India's tomato prices surge over 300%, sparking theft and turmoil
description: India's tomato prices have skyrocketed more than 300% as a result of extreme weather conditions.

title: From multi-millionaire entrepreneur to Indonesia's minister of tourism — meet Sandiaga Uno
description: Uno made his fortune with investment firm Saratoga Capital, before becoming deputy governor of Jakarta in 2017. He was appointed tourism minister in 2020.

title: China's chip metal export curbs are 'a wake up call' for countries to diversify their supply chains
description: While China produces the majority of the world's gallium and germanium, it is not the only producer.
